problem_statement: Real-time telemetry systems face a critical bottleneck known as

where a lagging WebSocket client blocks the core metrics collection loop, causing the entire monitoring service to freeze. Mid-tier implementations naively couple the sampling interval with the network transmission, resulting in a system that collapses under minor network latency or high concurrent client counts. The required architectural gap is implementing a strict Producer-Consumer model using Go channels, where the sampling goroutine acts as an independent producer that pushes state to a central distribution hub, completely agnostic to whether the downstream network clients can keep up.
FAIL_TO_PASS: Slow consumer does not block broadcaster
Slow consumer handled correctly with real connection
Client registry returns to zero after disconnects
Clients are cleaned up on disconnect
Select statement uses default case correctly
Client registry is protected by mutex
